#n, k0
{2, 4}
#Integrated cross section, s = sign(k0), m = |k0|; {s*(m-2), -s(m-1), sm, -s(m+1), s(m+2)}
{1, 1, 6, 1, 1}
#coefficients 5x5 table, rows and column index refer to the same kappa as the column index for the integrated cross section
{{0.2857142857142857, -0.3673469387755102, 1.475023494245421, 0, 0}, {-0.3673469387755102, -0.6938775510204082, -0.7862409619540650, -0.9769664364860593, 0}, {1.475023494245421, -0.7862409619540650, -5.423718051817496, 0.9304666282259821, 2.713047617356441}, {0, -0.9769664364860593, 0.9304666282259821, 0.04329004329004329, 0.1983799002145385}, {0, 0, 2.713047617356441, 0.1983799002145385, 0.9090909090909091}}
#The one photon case follows. The final kappas are sorted as {s(m-1),-sm,s(m+1)} and the coefficients then end up in a 3x3 table instead.
#Denominator coefficients:
{1.0, 1.0, 1.0}
#Numerator coefficients:
{{0.28571428571428571429, 0.24743582965269675622, -1.46385010942279976903}, {0.24743582965269675622, -0.95238095238095238095, -0.28171808490950552584}, {-1.46385010942279976903, -0.28171808490950552584, 0.66666666666666666667}}
